qas.question: Who bombarded the city of Strasbourg?
What date was the Museum of Fine Arts destroyed by fire?
What cathedral was damaged along with the medieval church of Temple Neuf?
How many inhabitants were left without shelter after the siege?
How many civilians died during the siege?
How many people lived in the city before the Siege of Strasbourg?
In what year was the Hortus deliciarum written?
How many soldiers were injured during the Siege of Strasbourg?
In what style was the Museum of Fine Arts built?
To what era did the Museum of Fine Arts date?

context: During the Franco-Prussian War and the Siege of Strasbourg, the city was heavily bombarded by the <a0_0>Prussian army<a0_0/>. The bombardment of the city was meant to break the morale of the people of Strasbourg. On <a1_0>24 and 26 August <b6_0>1870<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the Museum of Fine Arts was destroyed by fire, as was the Municipal Library housed in the Gothic former Dominican church, with its unique collection of medieval manuscripts (most famously the Hortus deliciarum), rare Renaissance books, archeological finds and historical artifacts. The <a2_0><b8_0>gothic<b8_0/><a2_0/> cathedral was damaged as well as the <b9_0>medieval<b9_0/> church of Temple Neuf, the theatre, the city hall, the court of justice and many houses. At the end of the siege <a3_0><b5_0>10,000<b5_0/><a3_0/> inhabitants were left without shelter; over 600 died, including <a4_0>261<a4_0/> civilians, and 3200 were injured, including <b7_0>1,100<b7_0/> civilians.
